title: Attention turns to arbitration, WBC
subtitle: Attention turns to arbitration, WBC
body: Last week was all about history, and now the focus shifts to the future. After putting in motion plans to hang Bruce Sutter's plaque on the wall in the Hall of Fame, the game will hang up a "Coming Attractions" sign.  All the principal items on this week's agenda fall in the "groundwork" category, paving the road for baseball's journey toward the start of the 2006 season.  Â• Tuesday is the deadline for players and their teams to file figures for salary arbitration hearings, which will begin on Feb. 1 for cases not yet resolved. Tom Singer is a reporter for MLB.com This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Tom Singer
